net.theblackchamber.crypto.implementations

Class SecureProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<Object,Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • net.theblackchamber.crypto.implementations.SecureProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>

    public class SecureProperties
extends Properties
    Extension of the java Properties class which will provide the ability to transparently use encrypted properties.
    Usage: In order to make use of encryped properties the properties file should contain an entry key-path which will point to a keystore file created via KeystoreUtils.
    Calling setProperty on a new property with name containing "-unencrypted" will result in the value being added to the Properties map with the name changed from XX-unencrypted to XX-encrypted and the value being encoded.
    Calling getProperty for a property with key containing -encrypted in the name will result in the value being decoded and the clear text value returned.
    Author:
    sminogue
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public Key getKey()
        Gets the encryption key to be used for encryption and decryption. The path to this file will have been specified in the properties file with the key: "key-path" or have been passed in by parameter
        Returns:

      • getEncryptionProvider

        public EncryptionProvider getEncryptionProvider()
        Gets the encryption provider. This is the Provider which will be used to encrypt and decrypt properties.
        Returns:

      • getProperty

        public String getProperty(String key)
        Overrides:
        getProperty in class Properties
        Throws:
        RuntimeCryptoException - If no encryption key was configured. This usually happens when no key was successfully loaded. .
        See Also:
        If property key ends in "-encrypted" this method will attempt to decrypt before returning the value.

      • getProperty

        public String getProperty(String key,
                 String defaultValue)
        Overrides:
        getProperty in class Properties
        Throws:
        RuntimeCryptoException - If no encryption key was configured. This usually happens when no key was successfully loaded.
        See Also:
        If property key ends in "-encrypted" this method will attempt to decrypt before returning the value.

      • setProperty

        public Object setProperty(String key,
                 String value)
        Overrides:
        setProperty in class Properties
        Throws:
        RuntimeCryptoException - If no encryption key was configured. This usually happens when no key was successfully loaded.
        See Also:
        If property key ends in -unencrypted this method will attempt to encrypt the value prior to adding it. If the property key is "key-path" then the encryption will be re-initialized using the specified key. NOTE: If you specify key-path its important to have FIRST specified entry-name and keystore-password or an error will occur.
